attributes.action: cancel plans for new housing with it's destructive irreversible changes while net immigation is at high levels
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Government plans to build an extra 250,000 houses by 2016, above the 200,000 a year already planned.

Each new development results in irreversble loss of open space (official or unofficial), wildlife, turns villages into high density towns, increases urban stress, overloads local schools, roads, hospitals, water and food supplies, and over-burdens limited fuel supplies.

Net immigration in 2005 was 292,000.  Government projections show net immigration adding 6 million to the UK population between 2004 and 2031.  All these people will need housing.

It makes no sense to destroy historic towns and villages, and worsen over-crowding to provide housing for people who currently have no connection with the UK.  A simpler, cheaper and more rational solution exists.
